intro: Uncinia rigida, commonly known as the rigid hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields. Uncinia rigida is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
